page.title: 19YARKHILL
page.content: Yarkhill church was probably built in the 12th C. The churchwardens staves were presented in memory of Willam Thomas Barnes 1938-1982 by his family and friends. The organ was presented in memory of Alice Hollings 1898-1973 organist for 52 years. There is only one bell in use but the tower holds 4 bells. The Gargoyles are shaped into lions. There are stone carvings of kings, queens,knights and ladies. The oldest gravestone we could read was from 1732. Near the church is a square moat, which is overgrown. Yarkhill Court Farm is a mixture of red brick and black and white timbered buildings.In the nearby field is a cow shed with chimneys on either end.
